Title: Reply to "Structural and magnetic behavior of the cubic oxyfluoride SrFeO2F studied by neutron diffraction"
Abstract: © 2015 Elsevier Inc.In this article we comment on the results published by Thompson et al. (, J. Solid State Chem. 219 (2014) 173-178) on the crystal structure of SrFeO2F, who claim the compound to crystallize in the cubic space group Pm-3m. We give a more detailed explanation of the determination of our previously reported structural model with Imma symmetry (Clemens et al., J. Solid State Chem. 206 (2013) 158-169), with addition of variable temperature XRD measurements with high counting time to provide unambiguous evidence for the Imma model being correct for our sample.
